column4: what does this mean: SIOCSIFFLAGS: Cannot assign requested address
i just changed the interfaces file, and restarted the networking service, when those flags showed up
yes; i do not see anything too wrong with it ... i would use eth0 and eth0:1 as the two interfaces but other than that it looks sane
i shall try that... other than that, i just have dhcp, dns server running, and one small change in the ip tables
that did it, changing the eth0:0 to eth0 :D thanks!
can't remember, i think from the website or the repo.. but the broadcom wireless isn't working either
you may have to reinstall fglrx... broadcom may be a regression. try installing linux-backports-modules-wireless-lucid-generic
